intro: Strophanthus kontumensis, commonly known as the Kontum strophantus, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia, particularly Vietnam. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes many plants with cardiac glycosides. The plant is characterized by its striking yellow or orange flowers and woody stems. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along stream banks. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated for horticultural purposes.
